citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
An adult female Cavalier King Charles Spaniel (microchip ID #900164001981251) had a premolar on the left side of its
mouth with some tartar buildup. In addition, the tooth was loose. The licensee had not observed this prior to inspection.
Not making timely observations can result in dental issues like the one noted here. Undiagnosed and untreated dental
issues can result in an infection that could become systemic and cause serious illness. In addition, untreated dental
issues can be painful. The licensee must conduct daily observations on each and every animal to assess their health and
well-being. Any medical issues must be documented and treated per the attending veterinarian's instructions. Correct by
9/10/25.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
End of report.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(3) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
An adult female Cavalier King Charles Spaniel (microchip ID #900164001981251) had a premolar on the left side of its 
mouth with some tartar buildup. In addition, the tooth was loose. The licensee had not observed this prior to inspection. 
Not making timely observations can result in dental issues like the one noted here. Undiagnosed and untreated dental 
issues can result in an infection that could become systemic and cause serious illness. In addition, untreated dental 
issues can be painful. The licensee must conduct daily observations on each and every animal to assess their health and 
well-being. Any medical issues must be documented and treated per the attending veterinarian's instructions. Correct by 
9/10/25. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
End of report. 
 
 n
